titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Alan B. Moody Papers LSC.0420
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Charlotte Payne, February 1976; machine-readable finding aid created by Caroline Cub√©.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-07-18 11:56:52 -0700.

did.abstract: Alan Moody (1900-1944)was an architect, playwright and novelist who made his home in Southern California. The collection consists of manuscripts, a book, press clippings and reviews relating to Alan Moody.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Alan B. Moody Papers (Collection 420). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

acqinfo.head: Provenance/Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Mrs. John Odin and the Santa Monica Public Library, 1975.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Moody was born in 1900; he became an architect, playwright, and novelist who made his home in Southern California; works include The questionable Elaine, a three-act play produced in 1930, and Sleep in the sun, a novel published in 1945; he died in 1944.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of manuscripts, a book, press clippings and reviews relating to Alan Moody. Includes a copy of his Sleep in the sun. Manuscripts include All but the bride, The high street, Myra, The restless flame, and To the son!

did.unittitle: All but the bride; a comedy in three acts. n.p.
The high street. Santa Monica, California.
The restless flame. Santa Monica, California.
did.physdesc: l p.l., 173 leaves. Typescript. Novel. In two parts.

did.unittitle: The restless flame. Santa Monica, California.
did.physdesc: l p.l., 84 leaves. Typescript (carbon). Novel. Part 1 only.

did.unittitle: To the son! Santa Monica, California.
did.physdesc: 2 p.l., 70 leaves. Typescript (carbon). Stageplay. Another version of "All but the bride."

did.unittitle: The questionable Elaine. Press clippings and reviews of the play by Alan Moody. v.p.
Sleep in the sun. Press clippings and reviews of the novel by Alan Moody. v.p.
Novel published as Sleep in the sun by Alan Moody. Illustrated by Edwin Earle. Boston: Houghton-Mifflin Company.
